obese women still remain to be investigated [99].
A systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that dietary intervention during pregnancy is safe and potentially 
cost-effective in limiting GWG, improving maternal and child health and reducing the risk of GDM, gestational 
hypertension, pre-eclampsia, preterm birth [100], intrauterine death [101] and metabolic disorders [102,103].
